column1: San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec (Nahuatl languages: Tōchtepēc
column3: or simply referred to as Tuxtepec
column4: is the head of the municipality by the same name and is the second most populous city of the Mexican state of Oaxaca.

column1: It is part of the Tuxtepec District of the Papaloapan Region.

column2: the city is home to a population of 94
column4: 555 in the municipality (0.979% of the state population)
column5: though census data are often under reported for various reasons. The municipality resides in the region called La Cuenca (Spanish for “The Basin”)
column6: is located 36 feet above sea level
column7: and occupies an area of approximately 580 square miles (1
column8: 500 km2). The city itself is surrounded by the Papaloapan River
column9: and lies a few kilometers south of the Cerro de Oro Dam on its tributary the Santo Domingo River.

column1: The municipality is bordered by the state of Veracruz in the north
column2: the municipalities of Loma Bonita to the east and San José Chiltepec to the south. It is almost 100 miles (160 km) to the port of Veracruz
column5: and 310 miles (500 km) to Mexico City.

column1: The city serves as municipal seat of the municipality
column2: having jurisdiction over the following communities:

column27: Centro de Población Rosario Ibarra de Piedra
column57: El Mirador Mata de Caña (Lino Ramírez)
column81: Francisco I. Madero de los Cerritos Río Tonto

column2: the municipality covers an area of 933.9 km² (360.58 sq mi) and reported a census population of 144
column4: which includes many small outlying communities.

column1: Municipal President Fernando Bautista Dávila died in 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic in Mexico.
